title: Govt not willing to answer questions on inferior quality coal unless allegation is proven: Minister
byline: The government is not willing to answer any questions on the import of inferior quality coal unless it is proven that such coal has caused adverse effects, Environment Minister Dhammika Patabendi told Parliament today.

title: Around 700 arrested daily in over drug related offences: Minister
byline: Around 700 persons are arrested daily over drug related offences, Minister of Justice Harshana Nanayakkara told Parliament today.

title: Radiologist accused of sexually abusing foreign woman
byline: A foreign tourist has complained to the Galle police against a radiologist in a private hospital in Galle who is alleged to have sexually harassed her when she was referred to him for an ultrasound scan

title: Why does Trump want Greenland and what could it mean for Nato?
byline: US President Donald Trump insists his country needs to acquire Greenland for national security reasons and has not ruled out using military force.

title: AI to threaten 22.8 percent of employed people in Sri Lanka
byline: A new study by the Institute of Policy Studies (IPS) shows that about 1.83 million Sri Lankan workers, or roughly 22.8 percent of the employed population, are in occupations that could be exposed to Generative Artificial Intelligence (GenAI), which means that AI has some influence over job security for these workers.

title: Man arrested under PMLA with Rs. 283.3 million in cash
byline: A 40-year-old man has been arrested under the Prevention of Money Laundering Act (PMLA) after police seized Rs. 283.3 million in cash and two vehicles suspected to have been illegally acquired.

title: Italian fashion designer Valentino dies aged 93
byline: Italian fashion designer Valentino Garavani, known as Valentino, has died at the age of 93.

title: Trump threatens 200% tariff on French wines as Macron reportedly snubs ‘Board of Peace’ seat
byline: U.S. President Donald Trump on Tuesday threatened to impose 200% tariffs on French wines and champagne after French President Emmanuel Macron was reported to be unwilling to join his “Board of Peace” on Gaza.

title: Vehicle imports generate Rs. 904 billion: Deputy Minister
byline: The government has collected a total income of Rs. 904 billion from vehicle imports, more than double the initially projected target of Rs. 441 billion, Deputy Minister of Economic Development Nishantha Jayaweera told Parliament today (20).

title: DM lead story comes to limelight in Parliament
byline: The lead story of today’s Daily Mirror titled ’AI to  threaten 23.8 percent of employed people in Sri Lanka’ came to the limelight in Parliament when Opposition MP Harsha de Silva quoted it while highlighting that AI has already affected some jobs.

title: 1,000 Sri Lankan nurses to work in Israel next year
byline: The Sri Lanka Bureau of Foreign Employment (SLBFE) plans to send 1,000 Sri Lankans to Israel for home-based nursing jobs in 2026.

title: Mahindananda’s appeal against conviction and sentence fixed for hearing
byline: The Supreme Court today fixed 9 March for the hearing of the appeal applications filed by former Sports Minister Mahindananda Aluthgamage and former Lanka Sathosa Chairman Nalin Fernando, challenging the legality of the High Court judgment that convicted and sentenced them over the controversial carrom board case.

title: Government willing to accommodate debate on NCM against PM this week
byline: The government is ready to debate the no confidence motion on Prime Minister Harini Amarasuriya on Thursday and Friday this week, Chief Government Whip Nalinda Jayatissa told Parliament today.

title: Private sector minimum wage hiked to Rs. 30,000 from Jan 2026
byline: The national minimum wage in the private sector will rise from Rs. 27,000 to Rs. 30,000, effective 1 January 2026, Labour Department Commissioner General H.M.D.N.K. Wataliyadda said.

title: SLAP hosts networking forum to empower regional printers
byline: The Sri Lanka Association of Printers (SLAP), in collaboration with the Vavuniya District Printers Owners Co-Operative Society, successfully conducted a Strategic Networking Forum on 18th January 2025 in Vavuniya, marking another important milestone in SLAP’s mission to strengthen and unify the printing industry across the country.

title: Minister Bimal Rathnayake casts doubts on Ashoka Ranwala’s doctorate
byline: Transport, Highways and Urban Development Minister Bimal Rathnayake said that he does not believe former Speaker Ashoka Ranwala possesses a certificate to substantiate his claimed doctorate, given the failure to produce such a document over an extended period.

title: Cold weather triggers rise in viral illnesses
byline: The spread of several viral diseases is on the rise due to the prevailing cold weather conditions, Gampaha Hospital Senior Medical Officer Dr. Ravinda Udagamage warned.

title: Not willing to answer questions on adverse effects of inferior quality coal without evidence: Minister
byline: Claiming that the government is not willing to answer questions about any adverse effects that could result from using inferior quality coal for power generation, Environment Minister Dhammika Prasad today said he would respond once it is proven with evidence that the use of so-called inferior quality coal would cause any issues.

title: Around 700 arrested daily over drug related offences: Minister
byline: Around 700 persons are arrested daily over drug related offences, Minister of Justice Harshana Nanayakkara told Parliament today.

title: Two Sri Lankans remanded over brawl in Velana airport
byline: Criminal Court has remanded two Sri Lankan nationals arrested for alleged violence in Velana International Airport (VIA) in Maldives in custody for 15 days on Monday.

title: Trump says UK’s Chagos Islands deal with Mauritius is an act of ’great stupidity’
byline: US President Donald Trump on Tuesday criticised the UK’s deal to hand sovereignty of the Chagos Islands to Mauritius, calling it an ’’act of great stupidity’’ and ’’total weakness.’’

title: Scotland could replace Bangladesh at T20 World Cup after ICC ‘issues ultimatum’
byline: Cricket’s international governing body has reportedly issued an ultimatum to Bangladesh to confirm their T20 World Cup participation in India by Wednesday or risk being replaced by another team.

title: President issues gazette to award 75th Anniversary Navy Medal
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake has issued a Gazette Extraordinary to award a commemorative medal to all ranks of the Regular and Volunteer Forces of the Sri Lanka Navy, as well as civil employees of the approved cadre, to mark the 75th Anniversary of the Sri Lanka Navy.

title: CPSL condemns US arms sales to Taiwan province, affirms One China policy
byline: The Communist Party of Sri Lanka (CPSL) strongly condemns the recent announcement by the United States of an unprecedented US$ 11.1 billion arms sale to China’s Taiwan province. This reckless escalation – encompassing advanced rocket systems, artillery, missiles, loitering munitions and associated equipment – constitutes a grave interference in China’s internal affairs and a direct provocation against peace and stability in Asia.

title: Southern Province launches ‘SP Bus’ mobile app for passengers
byline: The Southern Provincial Road Passenger Transport Authority has introduced a new mobile application to provide passengers with real-time information on bus services, including arrival times at bus stops across the Southern Province.

title: Cabinet approves resumption of Baseline Road Extension Project phase III
byline: The government has approved the resumption of Phase III of the Baseline Road Extension Project, which involves the construction of a six-lane road from Kirulapona Junction to Dutugemunu Street on the Colombo-Horana Road.

title: Trump threatens 200% tariff on French wines as Macron reportedly snubs ‘Board of Peace’ seat
byline: U.S. President Donald Trump on Tuesday threatened to impose 200% tariffs on French wines and champagne after French President Emmanuel Macron was reported to be unwilling to join his “Board of Peace” on Gaza.

title: Daily Mirror sweeps Journalism Awards for Excellence 2024 bagging seven awards
byline: The Daily Mirror won several top awards at the Journalism Awards for Excellence 2024, highlighting its strong presence across journalism platforms.

title: Singapore Airlines adds three new daytime flights to Colombo
byline: Singapore Airlines has expanded its operations between Colombo and Singapore with the launch of three additional daytime flights, effective January 6, further strengthening air connectivity between Sri Lanka and the airline’s global network.

title: First school term begins tomorrow
byline: The second phase of the first school term for the 2026 academic year in government and government-approved private schools will commence tomorrow (21), the Education Ministry announced.

title: Market ends mixed as investors await earnings clarity
byline: The Colombo Stock Exchange closed the session on a mixed note, with the ASPI edging lower while the S&P SL20 posted marginal gains, highlighting the lack of a clear market direction.

title: BASL calls for protection of Attorney General’s independence
byline: The Bar Association of Sri Lanka (BASL) has strongly emphasised that it is the duty of the Government and law enforcement agencies to ensure that there is no unwarranted interference with the exercise of the powers of the Attorney General.
